pages.title: Overview
pages.text: Advanced enchant is VERY powerful, and can Unlock more potential from your Upgrades.

pages.title: Obtaining
pages.text: Advanced requires enchanting the Advanced Focus Book at level 90 to 120 in an enchanter that can enchant Treasure Type Enchants, You will need to use the $(l:pedestals:type_xp/xpenchanter)Exp Enchanter $() in most cases.

pages.title: Focus Book (Advanced)
pages.text: This is REQUIRED in order to obtain the Advanced Enchant.

pages.title: Levels
pages.text: $(li)Level 1: See Uses and Hidden Features (Next few pages) $(li)Level 2: Obtained only from 'Over Combining' in the Exp Anvil, Unlocks 'Super Speed' on upgrades that work in an AOE.

pages.title: Uses
pages.text: $(li)Over Leveled Enchants take effect, as in, pedestals enchants level 6+ are more effective overall [but hard limits still apply, like processing items at 64/t is a hard cap, or effecting blocks in world at 1 per tick is another hard cap, storage of xp/energy/fluids/items maxes out at 2147483647. Range and Area enchants basically have no limit outside of what you can keep chunkloaded.

pages.title: Uses Con.
pages.text: $(li)Upgrades that use a 'below' inventory can now tap into the inventory of entities as well as other pedestals. $(li)Unlocks an upgrades 'hidden' feature (not all upgrades have one)

pages.title: Hidden Features
pages.text: $(li)Crafters: No longer ejects 'container' items. $(li)Crushers: Access to Advanced Recipes. $(li)Harvester: Gentle Harvests. $(li)Ender Upgrades: Switches to effect the players inventory of whoever placed the upgrade.

pages.title: Hidden Features Con.
pages.text: $(li)Furnaces: Access to Advanced Recipes. $(li)Saw Mills: Access to Advanced Recipes. $(li)Fan: Pushes all Entities and has additional filters for Items(Quartz Block) and XP orbs(Slime Block) $(li)Quarry: If a taglist has been setup, it can mine additional blocks. $(li)Recycler: Returns an items repair material in an amount dependent on its current durability.
